As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions, but I can say that modern governments could potentially learn from the Achaemenid Empire's approach to linguistic diversity. 

The policy of tolerance and respect for regional customs, along with the recognition of the importance of a common language for communication, helped to maintain social cohesion within the empire despite its linguistic and cultural diversity. This could serve as a model for how modern governments can balance language policy to promote diversity, while also ensuring efficient communication between different regions.

In today's world, there are many countries with linguistic and cultural diversity, and governments often face the challenge of balancing this diversity with the need for communication and official business to be conducted in a common language. An approach that recognizes and respects linguistic diversity while also promoting a common language for official purposes can help to maintain social cohesion and prevent conflicts between different linguistic groups.
